results.title: Treatment With Lisinopril Prevents the Early Progression of Glomerular Injury in Obese Dahl Salt-Sensitive Rats Independent of Lowering Arterial Pressure
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ treatment had no effect on GFR in SS @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Brown AK, Nichols A, Coley CA, Ekperikpe US, McPherson KC, Shields CA, Poudel B, Cornelius DC, Williams JM. Treatment With Lisinopril Prevents the Early Progression of Glomerular Injury in Obese Dahl Salt-Sensitive Rats Independent of Lowering Arterial Pressure Front Physiol. 2021;12():765305. PMID: 34975523

results.title: Adverse interactions of rofecoxib with lisinopril in spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: The histological examination revealed that the myocardial and @<m>DISEASE_Glycosuria_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006030 @@@renal@@@ protection induced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@LS@@@ was attenuated by concomitant @CHEMICAL_rofecoxib @CHEMICAL_MESH:C116926 @@@RF@@@ therapy.

citations.NLM: Dubey K, Balani DK, Tripathi CB, Singh R, Bajaj R, Pillai KK. Adverse interactions of rofecoxib with lisinopril in spontaneously hypertensive rats. Clin Toxicol (Phila). 2005;43(5):361-73. PMID: 16235511
citations.BibTeX: @article{16235511, title={Adverse interactions of rofecoxib with lisinopril in spontaneously hypertensive rats.}, author={Dubey K and Balani DK and Tripathi CB and Singh R and Bajaj R and Pillai KK}, journal={Clin Toxicol (Phila)}, volume={43}, number={5}, pages={361-73}}

results.title: Hypertension after renal transplantation. Calcium channel or converting enzyme blockade?
results.text_hl: The data indicate that @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ is more effective than @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in controlling @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ in @CHEMICAL_Cyclosporine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D016572 @@@cyclosporine@@@-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ and that treatment with @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ but not with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ is accompanied by an increase in glomerular filtration rate and effective renal plasma flow and a decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Glycosuria_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006030 @@@renal vascular@@@ resistance.

citations.NLM: van der Schaaf MR, Hené RJ, Floor M, Blankestijn PJ, Koomans HA. Hypertension after renal transplantation. Calcium channel or converting enzyme blockade? Hypertension. 1995 Jan;25(1):77-81. PMID: 7843758
citations.BibTeX: @article{7843758, title={Hypertension after renal transplantation. Calcium channel or converting enzyme blockade?}, author={van der Schaaf MR and Hené RJ and Floor M and Blankestijn PJ and Koomans HA}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={25}, number={1}, pages={77-81}}

results.title: Effects of mycophenolate mofetil and lisinopril on collagen deposition in unilateral ureteral obstruction in rats.
results.text_hl: In this study, we investigated the effects of @CHEMICAL_Mycophenolic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009173 @@@mycophenolate mofetil@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Mycophenolic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009173 @@@MMF@@@), the @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ (@GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@ACE@@@) inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Leucine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007930 @@@L@@@), and the combination of both drugs, given daily for 14 days to @DISEASE_Ureteral_Obstruction @DISEASE_MESH:D014517 @@@UUO@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, on the @<m>DISEASE_Glycosuria_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006030 @@@renal fibrogenic process@@@ triggered by @DISEASE_Ureteral_Obstruction @DISEASE_MESH:D014517 @@@UUO@@@.

citations.NLM: Gonçalves RG, Biato MA, Colosimo RD, Martinusso CA, Pecly ID, Farias EK, Cardoso LR, Takiya CM, Ornellas JF, Leite M Jr. Effects of mycophenolate mofetil and lisinopril on collagen deposition in unilateral ureteral obstruction in rats. Am J Nephrol. 2004 Sep-Oct;24(5):527-36. PMID: 15499219
citations.BibTeX: @article{15499219, title={Effects of mycophenolate mofetil and lisinopril on collagen deposition in unilateral ureteral obstruction in rats.}, author={Gonçalves RG and Biato MA and Colosimo RD and Martinusso CA and Pecly ID and Farias EK and Cardoso LR and Takiya CM and Ornellas JF and Leite M Jr}, journal={Am J Nephrol}, volume={24}, number={5}, pages={527-36}}

results.title: Acute Kidney Injury Associated with Linagliptin
results.text_hl: In the present case, we hypothesize that @DISEASE_Acute_Kidney_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D058186 @@@AKI@@@ occurred from @<m>DISEASE_Glycosuria_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006030 @@@renal hypoperfusion@@@ caused by @CHEMICAL_Linagliptin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069476 @@@linagliptin@@@-induced natriuresis and intravascular volume contraction in the setting of concomitant @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ administration.

citations.NLM: Nandikanti DK, Gosmanova EO, Gosmanov AR. Acute Kidney Injury Associated with Linagliptin Case Rep Endocrinol. 2016;2016():5695641. PMID: 26981294
citations.BibTeX: @article{26981294, title={Acute Kidney Injury Associated with Linagliptin}, author={Nandikanti DK and Gosmanova EO and Gosmanov AR}, journal={Case Rep Endocrinol}, volume={2016}, pages={5695641}}
